dc:oaiDcType.dc:title: Data and Code for: When Does Regulation Distort Costs? Lessons from Fuel Procurement in US Electricity Generation: Comment.
dc:oaiDcType.dc:creator: Jin Soo Han
Jean-François Houde
Arthur A. van Benthem
Jose Miguel Abito
dc:oaiDcType.dc:description: We revisit one of the results in Cicala (2015) and show that the previously estimated large and significant effects of U.S. electricity restructuring on fuel procurement are not robust to the presence of outliers. Using methodologies from the robust statistics literature, we estimate the effect to be less than half of the previous estimate and not statistically different from zero. The robust methodology also identifies as outliers the plants owned by a single company whose coal contracts were renegotiated before discussions about restructuring even started.
dc:oaiDcType.dc:subject: power plants

• Energy Information Administration, Electric Power Monthly Tables and Survey Forms EIA-423, FERC-423, EIA-759, EIA-767, EIA-860, EIA-861, EIA-876, EIA-906, and EIA-923. 1990-2009.
  • Environmental Protection Agency, Air Markets Program Data and eGRID. 1996-2012.
  • Thomson Reuters, M&A Data. 1990-2009
  • Regulatory Research Associates, Regulatory Focus. 1990-1998.
